description: Managed and executed large-scale data preprocessing and analysis pipelines for training foundational language models. Utilized Python, Pandas, and NumPy to process terabytes of text data, ensuring data quality and feature integrity for model consumption.

Investigated neural coding principles by developing and applying sophisticated machine learning models to analyze multi-electrode recording data from the visual cortex, with the objective of decoding sensory information from raw spike train patterns.

project_experience.name: Predictive Text Model from EEG Signals
description: Architected and implemented a sophisticated deep learning model, leveraging a combination of Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs) and Long Short-Term Memory (LSTM) networks with TensorFlow and Keras. The model was designed to effectively classify complex, high-dimensional brainwave patterns from raw EEG data.

Attained a benchmark accuracy of 85% in decoding and predicting user's intended text directly from real-time neural signals, demonstrating the model's high fidelity and potential for brain-computer interface (BCI) applications.

Engineered a novel data augmentation pipeline specifically for time-series EEG data, which synthetically expanded the training dataset by 300%. This significantly improved model generalization and robustness against signal noise and subject-specific variability.
